content:
• Friday, November 4, 2011
  • OSK

    Oshkosh (OSK +3.4%) outperformed today after Carl Icahn disclosed in a 14-A filing that he's...

    Oshkosh (OSK +3.4%) outperformed today after Carl Icahn disclosed in a 14-A filing that he's nominating six candidates to the truck manufacturer's board. Icahn, who owns over 10% of Oshkosh's shares, is widely rumored to be pushing for a merger with rival Navistar (NAV +0.5%), in which he holds a 9.9% stake.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) fell 3.3% after it was learned its Nook Tablet, due on Monday,...

    Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) fell 3.3% after it was learned its Nook Tablet, due on Monday, will sell for $50 more than the Kindle Fire. Investors appear critical of B&N's unwillingness to match Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) on pricing, but it's hard to overlook how Amazon has deeper pockets than B&N, and more ways to offset hardware losses. Meanwhile, Amazon is reportedly prepping an 8.9-inch Kindle Fire.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • LPSN

    LivePerson (LPSN +9.1%), which shot higher last week on buyout hopes, gained more ground today...

    LivePerson (LPSN +9.1%), which shot higher last week on buyout hopes, gained more ground today after reporting Q3 revenue of $34.3M (+22% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.09; the former was only in-line, but the latter beat by a penny. Q4 guidance for revenue of $36.5M-$37M and EPS of $0.08-$0.10 is slightly below Street estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • POWR

    Energy-conservation company PowerSecure (POWR +28%) surged today after posting solid Q3 results...

    Energy-conservation company PowerSecure (POWR +28%) surged today after posting solid Q3 results that easily beat Street estimates on record revenue. Profits jumped 45% Y/Y with sales gains across all business lines. Top-line growth was driven by the expansion of its base of utility partners and the introduction of a number of new products and services.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) ends its trading debut with a heady 30% gain, but the $26.11 close was its...

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) ends its trading debut with a heady 30% gain, but the $26.11 close was its low price of the day. The next few days will tell the tale as a barometer of investor appetite for IPOs; a strong first few trading days could help the prospects of other private internet companies such as Zynga and even Facebook to pursue their own IPOs.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • RLOC

    ReachLocal (RLOC +16.1%) finishes with solid gains after its Board approved a $20M share buyback...

    ReachLocal (RLOC +16.1%) finishes with solid gains after its Board approved a $20M share buyback earlier today.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • CVS

    CVS Caremark (CVS +1.9%) finishes higher on a Morgan Stanley upgrade to Overweight earlier...

    CVS Caremark (CVS +1.9%) finishes higher on a Morgan Stanley upgrade to Overweight earlier today. Morgan says the company has improved pharmacy benefit management margins and is set for multiple expansion and strong earnings growth in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • SNP

    Sinopec (SNP +4.8%) posts a solid gain today on reports that China may allow the refiner to...

    Sinopec (SNP +4.8%) posts a solid gain today on reports that China may allow the refiner to adjust prices on their own.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • DGII

    Digi International (DGII -11%) gets slammed after its FQ4 results fall short of analysts'...

    Digi International (DGII -11%) gets slammed after its FQ4 results fall short of analysts' estimates. Top line margins were hit by a spike in operating expenses after flooding in Thailand cut off shipments from one of its key suppliers. The company also cuts guidance for the current quarter, now seeing sales between $45.5M - $49.5M and its EPS between $0.00 - $0.05.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • LYV

    Live Nation Entertainment (LYV -6.5%) CEO Michael Rapino tells CNBC the business is strong...

    Live Nation Entertainment (LYV -6.5%) CEO Michael Rapino tells CNBC the business is strong despite a surprise 7.3% attendance decline during the summer concert season, citing 5%-6% revenue growth in the Festivals, European and North American segments. Rapino doesn't see "deterioration" heading into Q4, but investors weren't listening today.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • ACOR

    Acorda Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ACOR), a developer of drugs for treating neurological disorders,...

    Acorda Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ACOR), a developer of drugs for treating neurological disorders, gains 14.6% after reporting Q3 revenue of $93M and EPS of $0.40; while the latter missed by $0.33, the former beat by $2.2M, and investors appear reassured by positive comments regarding market acceptance of the company's Ampyra MS drug, made in partnership with ELN.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • GNW

    Genworth (GNW +17.2%) soars to the top of the S&P leader board despite a 65% Y/Y drop in Q3...

    Genworth (GNW +17.2%) soars to the top of the S&P leader board despite a 65% Y/Y drop in Q3 earnings after a hit from tax items. But operating results easily beat expectations, and the insurer announced plans for a minority IPO of its Australian mortgage interest business, which Credit Suisse says could add $560M-$720M of immediate additional liquidity.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • CEDC

    Central European Distribution (CEDC -36%) gets hammered after its Q3 EPS badly misses Street...

    Central European Distribution (CEDC -36%) gets hammered after its Q3 EPS badly misses Street estimates. Operating profit was hit hard by a one time, non-cash goodwill impairment charge due to restructuring its Russia operations. The company also lowers FY11 net sales guidance, saying core markets continue to be challenged by increased raw spirit prices and FX rate movements. It now expects sales between $900M - $1B, below previous estimates of $850M -$950M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • NPTN

    Optical component vendor NeoPhotonics (NPTN -17.6%) makes a new low after reporting Q3 revenue...

    Optical component vendor NeoPhotonics (NPTN -17.6%) makes a new low after reporting Q3 revenue of $44M (-16% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.13, missing consensus by $2.7M and $0.03. NeoPhotonics, now down 64% from its February IPO price, blames the shortfall on weak orders from top customer Huawei, and is guiding for Q4 EPS of -$0.30 to -$0.40, well below a -$0.08 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +6.4%) marches higher after CEO Mark Smith tells CNBC that a proposed U.S....

    Molycorp (MCP +6.4%) marches higher after CEO Mark Smith tells CNBC that a proposed U.S. stockpile of rare earth materials at this time would actually create a little more tension in supply. Smith says MCP is "selling every kilogram" of material it is making, and that it would take "numerous years" of contraction to start to disrupt the supply/demand picture.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM | 4 Comments
  • MFLX

    Multi-Fineline (MFLX -18%) tanks after its Q3 report lands wide of the mark. Net sales were down...

    Multi-Fineline (MFLX -18%) tanks after its Q3 report lands wide of the mark. Net sales were down 15% Y/Y, primarily due to reduced sales to one key customer. Gross margin declined to 10 percent, compared to 14.1 percent for the same period in the prior year, as rising labor costs in China and an appreciating Chinese yuan cut heavily into the company's bottom-line. Needham downgrades the shares on the results.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • MDAS

    MedAssets (MDAS +19%) pops after its Q3 shreds Street EPS estimates. Net revenue rose 50% Y/Y,...

    MedAssets (MDAS +19%) pops after its Q3 shreds Street EPS estimates. Net revenue rose 50% Y/Y, primarily due to a lower tax rate and write-downs related to its 2010 acquisition of Broadlane. Oppenheimer and Morgan Stanley both issue positive comments after the results, reiterating their Outperform and Overwieght ratings on the shares (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • PDCE

    Petroleum Development (PETD +6.8%) rallies after its Q3 blows away estimates. Revenue doubled...

    Petroleum Development (PETD +6.8%) rallies after its Q3 blows away estimates. Revenue doubled Y/Y on a 24% jump in production over the prior period as the driller increased its number of operating wells to 39. Additionally, the company says its acquired the rights for up to 40,000 additional net acres in the Utica shale play for approximately $70M. Global Hunter upgrades the stock to Buy on the results.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO +7.4%) shares spike after CEO David Flynn tells CNBC the "surface hasn't...

    Fusion-io (FIO +7.4%) shares spike after CEO David Flynn tells CNBC the "surface hasn't even been scratched" in market penetration for the company's "revolutionizing" data storage, adding that Facebook and Apple (OTC:APPL) are part of its diversified customer base. This week, FIO reported quarterly results that beat estimates and raised its full-year revenue outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • AXLL

    Georgia Gulf (GGC +6.3%) lifts higher after its Q3 easily beats Street estimates. Profit rose...

    Georgia Gulf (GGC +6.3%) lifts higher after its Q3 easily beats Street estimates. Profit rose 23% Y/Y, aided by a one-time tax gain from its acquistion of Royal Group in 2006. Separately, JP Morgan upgrades the shares to Overweight on valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • RNWK

    RealNetworks (NASDAQ:RNWK), a one-time streaming video software giant that's turning into a...

    RealNetworks (NASDAQ:RNWK), a one-time streaming video software giant that's turning into a history footnote, falls 14.1% after reporting Q3 revenue of $84.4M (-2% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.15, missing consensus by $1.8M and $0.04. The company expects Q4 revenue to decline Q/Q; current forecasts are for a ~20% increase.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • RSTI

    Laser designer Rofin-Sinar Technologies (RSTI -10%) FQ4 easily beat estimates, but the stock...

    Laser designer Rofin-Sinar Technologies (RSTI -10%) FQ4 easily beat estimates, but the stock takes a hit after the company issues a cautious view for the current quarter. It now projects revenues to be in the range of $137M - $142M, sharply lower than analysts expectations. The company cites a sales slowdown in the Asian markets, particularly tightening in credit in China, for the reduced guidance.
     

     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • RRGB

    Shares of Red Robin (RRGB +9.3%) jump after its Q3 beats estimates late yesterday on higher...

    Shares of Red Robin (RRGB +9.3%) jump after its Q3 beats estimates late yesterday on higher revenue and better margins. Same-store gross sales at company-owned locations were up 2.1% Y/Y, as a 5.3% increase in the average guest check amount offset a 3.2% decline in customer traffic.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • PXP

    Plains Exploration (PXP +6.4%) trades higher after its Q3 easily beats estimates on a 15% jump...

    Plains Exploration (PXP +6.4%) trades higher after its Q3 easily beats estimates on a 15% jump in sales volumes. The company also unveiled plans to sell its working interest in its Texas panhandle region properties to Linn Energy (LINE +0.1%) for $600M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • UPL

    Ultra Petroleum (UPL +5.7%) jumps after its Q3 EPS beats estimates on record oil and natural gas...

    Ultra Petroleum (UPL +5.7%) jumps after its Q3 EPS beats estimates on record oil and natural gas volume, particularly at its Marcellus Shale project, where production leapt by 155% Y/Y. Overall margins improved significantly, with a 14% Y/Y return on capital and a corresponding 32% ROE.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • INHX

    The clean double in price of Inhibitex (INHX +131%) following its hepatitis C treatment...

    The clean double in price of Inhibitex (INHX +131%) following its hepatitis C treatment breakthrough could be sustaining, according to Deutsche's Robyn Karnauskas, who says a "near-term catalyst" is now in play for the firm. Shares of Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS) trail off 5% on the news, as the drug from Inhibitex shows a similar efficacy to the company's own treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • FBP

    First BanCorp (FBP -4.3%) dips after Cantor cuts the stock to Sell, citing the company's weak...

    First BanCorp (FBP -4.3%) dips after Cantor cuts the stock to Sell, citing the company's weak outlook for FY12.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • BAC

    Bank of America’s (BAC -4.2%) plan to issue common stock to raise funds probably will...

    Bank of America’s (BAC -4.2%) plan to issue common stock to raise funds probably will dilute shareholders, but the bigger issue may be a loss of credibility. The move "would have no material impact on long-term EPS," Mike Mayo says, but it "reflects poorly on management who were previously adamant that BAC did not need to raise any additional common capital."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 9 Comments
  • AAL

    AMR falls 5.4% after reporting its October passenger traffic fell 1.1% Y/Y - a reversal from...

    AMR falls 5.4% after reporting its October passenger traffic fell 1.1% Y/Y - a reversal from September's 1.9% gain. The airline's load factor fell 40 bps Y/Y, to 83.2%, thanks to a 130 bps decline in its international load factor.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +12.1%) shares rocket higher after Sprint (S +2.5%) says it may use proceeds...

    Clearwire (CLWR +12.1%) shares rocket higher after Sprint (S +2.5%) says it may use proceeds from an offering of seven- and 10-year notes to help finance its unprofitable partner. Sprint also says it could use proceeds to pay back existing debt or fund its network upgrade, but the company has previously refused even to discuss whether it would help Clearwire.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • VLO

    Shares of Valero Energy (VLO +0.2%) move higher on renewed speculation that the company is a...

    Shares of Valero Energy (VLO +0.2%) move higher on renewed speculation that the company is a target for a takeover. Volatility has surged in the stock over the past week on rumors of a bidding war building amongst its bigger rivals.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • GMCR

    While Green Mountain Coffee Roaster (GMCR +5.1%) and Starbucks (SBUX +7.4%) grab most of the...

    While Green Mountain Coffee Roaster (GMCR +5.1%) and Starbucks (SBUX +7.4%) grab most of the headlines, it's shares of Coffee Holding (JVA +9.1%) that have racked up a 194% YTD return - despite a sharp selloff since July. The company's private label and branded coffee lines attracted the notice of Roth as it lined up a Buy rating, and Beacon thinks the shorts attracted to the stock will get squeezed and run the share price up to $14.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • AMAG

    AMAG Pharmaceuticals (AMAG +16.3%) shares rally after announcing a Q3 earnings beat, the...

    AMAG Pharmaceuticals (AMAG +16.3%) shares rally after announcing a Q3 earnings beat, the resignation of its CEO, plans to cut a quarter of its employees, and a review of strategic options. “We’re evaluating all strategic alternatives available," interim CEO Frank Thomas said on a conference call. “This includes a possible sale, merger, acquisition or in-licensing opportunity."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • EQC

    CommonWealth REIT (CWH -3%) dips after Stifel Nicolaus cuts the shares to sell, saying that...

    CommonWealth REIT (CWH -3%) dips after Stifel Nicolaus cuts the shares to sell, saying that earnings and FFO value are eroding too quickly.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • CNW

    Con-Way (CNW -4.17%) reports an in-line Q3 as the trucker swings to a profit on broad revenue...

    Con-Way (CNW -4.17%) reports an in-line Q3 as the trucker swings to a profit on broad revenue growth in its freight and truckload businesses. However, the company says it's experiencing higher-than-anticipated maintenance costs for trucks purchased in the 2004-05 time frame. Trucks bought around then are suffering from poor quality, and problems are beginning to show up now.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • IMMR

    Immersion (IMMR -12%), a developer of haptic feedback technology, is off sharply after reporting...

    Immersion (IMMR -12%), a developer of haptic feedback technology, is off sharply after reporting Q3 revenue of $6.5M (flat Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.05, missing consensus by $1M and $0.05. The shortfall is blamed on medical and automative weakness, which offset smartphone licensing strength. Immersion now expects 2011 revenue of $29.5M-$30.5M, below a $32.1M consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL +9.2%) shares surge following an SEC filing out last night that...

    Universal Display (PANL +9.2%) shares surge following an SEC filing out last night that Discovery Capital, a 10%-plus owner of PANL stock, disclosed buying 300,000 shares at $44.67, worth ~$13.5M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • MED

    Direct seller Medifast (MED -4%) trades down after its Q3 misses the mark. Revenue from its...

    Direct seller Medifast (MED -4%) trades down after its Q3 misses the mark. Revenue from its direct selling channel increased 6% Y/Y, as its bottom line suffered from higher training costs and a lower average revenue per health coach per month. Separately, Northland Securities and Janney Capital downgrade the stock on the poor results.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • MSG

    Shares of Madison Square Garden (MSG +4.7%) trade higher after the company updates investors in...

    Shares of Madison Square Garden (MSG +4.7%) trade higher after the company updates investors in its Q3 report on the planned closure of Madison Square Garden and the impact of the unplanned NBA work stoppage on top-line results.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +2.5%) appears to be getting a lift from remarks made during ...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +2.5%) appears to be getting a lift from remarks made during  Starbucks' (SBUX +7%) FQ4 earnings call. CEO Howard Schultz said Starbucks expects to ship 50M K-Cups by month's end, and that K-Cup sales will drive future EPS upside. (SBUX FQ4)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • GRPN

    First trades for Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) are printing now, right around $30/share, up 50% from the...

    First trades for Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) are printing now, right around $30/share, up 50% from the IPO price.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • CREE

    Shares of LED lighting leader Cree (CREE +6.3%) pop on an AP report that China will phase out...

    Shares of LED lighting leader Cree (CREE +6.3%) pop on an AP report that China will phase out incandescent light bulbs within five years. China will ban imports and sales of 100-watt and higher incandescent bulbs from Oct. 1, 2012, the country's main planning agency says. Related stocks: LEDS +8.1%, VECO +7.1%, AIXG +2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • GSVC

    GSV Capital (GSVC -4.3%) - seen as a proxy for Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) as well as the social...

    GSV Capital (GSVC -4.3%) - seen as a proxy for Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) as well as the social network phenomenon due to its stakes in Groupon, Facebook, Twitter, and Zynga - is tumbling in early action. The fall may bode ill for shares in Groupon, which should start trading hands on the open market fairly soon.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +4.1%) trades higher after the company says late yesterday it's entered an...

    First Solar (FSLR +4.1%) trades higher after the company says late yesterday it's entered an agreement to provide engineering, procurement and construction services for NRG Energy's (NRG -0.7%) 66 megawatt Alpine solar project in Lancaster, Calif.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • RST

    Rosetta Stone (RST -20.6%) crashes to an all-time low after reporting Q3 revenue of $64.2M (+5%...

    Rosetta Stone (RST -20.6%) crashes to an all-time low after reporting Q3 revenue of $64.2M (+5% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.06; the latter beat by $0.07, but the former missed by $2.9M. The language software firm's bookings fell 10% Y/Y to $66M, and its ASP fell 18% to $326. Rosetta Stone expects Q4 revenue of just $64M-$70M, well below an $84.5M consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • ALJ

    Alon USA Energy (NYSE:ALJ) racks up a 14% gain after reporting a 76% Y/Y jump in Q3 revenue with...

    Alon USA Energy (NYSE:ALJ) racks up a 14% gain after reporting a 76% Y/Y jump in Q3 revenue with a better-than-expected profit. The company points to a turnaround of production at its Big Spring refinery as a driver for its boost in sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • FLR

    Fluor (FLR -6.9%) shares tumble as investors react to the company's Q3 results showing EPS of...

    Fluor (FLR -6.9%) shares tumble as investors react to the company's Q3 results showing EPS of $0.78, well below Street expectations. Fluor also lowered 2012 EPS estimates to $3.40-$3.80. The company recorded a Q3 profit on improved sales and margins after charges had pushed its industrial and infrastructure segment to a prior-year loss.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • TBI

    Sticking with the normal roadmap following a jobs report, staffing companies are showing trading...

    Sticking with the normal roadmap following a jobs report, staffing companies are showing trading volatility. The slight tick down in the unemployment rate isn't the headliner of the report, it's the overall gloomy trend that has the attention of investors. Decliners: KLYA -1.6%, TBI -1.7%, RHI -1.3%, MAN -1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • EXAM

    ExamWorks (EXAM -23.1%) falls off sharply after steering FY11 revenue guidance below the...

    ExamWorks (EXAM -23.1%) falls off sharply after steering FY11 revenue guidance below the estimates of analysts. The medical examination firm now sees revenue falling in at $390M-$395M - inclusive of results from its acquisitions, well-below prior guidance of $405M-$415M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM

  • Speaking at a G-20 press conference, Berlusconi says Italy has rejected the IMF's offer of...

    Speaking at a G-20 press conference, Berlusconi says Italy has rejected the IMF's offer of funds, even as it welcomes the agency coming in to monitor the country's fiscal reforms. He says the country is not giving up any sovereignty to the IMF. The euro isn't pleased, sinking to its low of the day at $1.3722.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 7 Comments
  • QSFT

    Quest Software (NASDAQ:QSFT), a developer of applications for managing IT hardware, gains 9.2%...

    Quest Software (NASDAQ:QSFT), a developer of applications for managing IT hardware, gains 9.2% after reporting Q3 revenue of $220.4M (+14% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.41, soundly beating consensus by $5.9M and $0.05. The company's deferred revenue balance rose 3% Q/Q and  21% Y/Y, to $457.6M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • SNE

    Sony (SNE -1.6%) drastically cuts its midterm sales target for LCD TVs to 20M from 40M, citing...

    Sony (SNE -1.6%) drastically cuts its midterm sales target for LCD TVs to 20M from 40M, citing high production costs and earnings that are getting hammered by a strong Yen. The company is also negotiating to exit a highly unprofitable panel-making venture with Samsung (OTC:SSNLF). Shares were down 8% in Tokyo trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • SBUX

    Shares of Starbucks (SBUX +5.3%) shoot higher on the open following the company's FQ4 earnings...

    Shares of Starbucks (SBUX +5.3%) shoot higher on the open following the company's FQ4 earnings beat. CEO Howard Schultz says in an earnings CC the retailer plans to open a modest 200 net stores in the U.S. - but will accelerate its pace in China. After opening 1 store every 4 days in mainland China in FY11, the company will accelerate that pace in FY12 on its way to a goal of 1.5K stores there by 2015.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • SPWR

    SunPower (SPWRA) shares swing lower after the solar panel maker reported a Q3 loss after booking...

    SunPower (SPWRA) shares swing lower after the solar panel maker reported a Q3 loss after booking massive impairment charges, masking revenue growth. The company also announced a shuffling of executives as part of a reorganization aimed at cutting costs and increasing competitiveness. SPWRA -9.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • TPR

    Morgan Stanley takes another look at luxury retailers after the sector has seen...

    Morgan Stanley takes another look at luxury retailers after the sector has seen better-than-expected sales figures in general. Analysts with the firm take ratings on Coach (COH), Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN), and Tiffany (NYSE:TIF) down to Equal Weight from Overweight. Premarket: TIF -1.4%, COH -1.2%, JWN -0.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) could open for trading this morning far above its $20 IPO price: Benzinga...

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) could open for trading this morning far above its $20 IPO price: Benzinga reports the current bid-ask spread for shares is $50.06-$50.84. Such a trading level would give the company a valuation north of $30B. GSV Capital (NASDAQ:GSVC), seen as a backdoor to the Groupon IPO, is up 2.3%. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 2 Comments

  • Congratulations eurocrats! Sovereign bond yields in the EU now fluctuate like currencies....

    Congratulations eurocrats! Sovereign bond yields in the EU now fluctuate like currencies. Italian bond yields are spiking higher over the past minutes, with the 10 year BTP moving to 6.35%, about the highest level since the debt crisis erupted. The BTP/Bund spread now sits at 450 basis points, the line at which collateral requirements for Italian paper could be raised.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • INHX

    Shares of Inhibitex (NASDAQ:INHX) skyrocket - up 128% premarket - after reporting positive...

    Shares of Inhibitex (NASDAQ:INHX) skyrocket - up 128% premarket - after reporting positive top-line safety and antiviral data from an ongoing clinical trial of its hepatitis C treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • INHX

    Premarket gainers: INHX +137%. OPWV +28%. AMAG +8%. YRCW +5%. STP +5%. CHK +5%. ARMH +4%. SBUX...

    Premarket gainers: INHX +137%. OPWV +28%. AMAG +8%. YRCW +5%. STP +5%. CHK +5%. ARMH +4%. SBUX +3%. BCS +3%.
    Losers: CEDC -22%. ALU -15%. AONE -15%. SGEN -13%. SWKS -5%. SD -4%. WIN -4%. HCN -4%. DB -3%. JEF -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • VVUS

    Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) says Phase III data published on its Qnexa obesity drug showed a 14.4%...

    Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) says Phase III data published on its Qnexa obesity drug showed a 14.4% average weight loss in severely obese patients completing one year of treatment. VVUS +3.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • SGEN

    Seattle Genetics (NASDAQ:SGEN) is down 12.9% in spite of yesterday's Q3 beat, fueled by growing...
